titles.title: Medicare Cost Contract Extension and Refinement Act of 2007
A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to extend reasonable cost contracts under Medicare.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S126-127)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary:
1/4/2007--Introduced.
Medicare Cost Contract Extension and Refinement Act of 2007 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to: (1) extend the period reasonable cost reimbursement contracts under Medicare can remain in the market, and the period during which they can be modified to expand their service area; and (2) apply to extended or renewed reasonable cost contracts certain requirements under Medicare part C (Medicare Advantage).
